course_description: This course will offer an overview of various ethical theories, constructs, and methodologies that characterize Western moral philosophy and, to some degree, the evolution of bioethics over the last three decades.  Topics will include an introduction to major theoretical approaches such as deontology, utilitarianism, virtue ethics, casuistry, natural law, principlism, moral relativism, and moral pluralism.
